stories.text: I'm curious to know if exists a Linux distribution heavily based on appimages. Or at least a way to configure a distribution to use appimages repository for installing software.
stories.title: Ask HN: Appimage Linux Distribution

US’ chip bid ‘futile,’ Morris Chang says
Do the same mechanisms that create complex life also create complex technology?

stories.text:
Each monitor I have (a Dell and a Samsung) require a carefully choreographed dance involving a procession of plugging and unplugging, switching things off and on and various experimental sequences to get everything up and running each morning. I have resorted to using a power board with individual switches to turn monitors off and then on again. This seems to be the only thing that works effectively.

It's suboptimal.

I would rather some monitors that simply woke up from sleep when my 2020 MBP wakes up. This can happen multiple times per day and I have resorted to using Caffeinated during the day to keep everything switched on. During the day it's not always as bad as first thing (deep sleep?), but it's slow and clunky.

Look, I would love a Mac Studio Display but I have no idea if it works this way... I've been so badly burned!

I'm not willing to part with $2500 AUD to make it happen too.

Any ideas? What experiences has the HN crowd had with monitors on the Mac of late?
stories.title: Can anyone suggest a monitor brand that plays well with Macs?
Elon Musk Texts Saudi Public Investment Fund
